text:
Can't find how to trigger workflows based on viewing specific landing pages in HubSpot. Have sales hub enterprise, operations hub pro, marketing hub starter.

Alternative solution could be a standalone form that submits itself - but can't figure out how to do this either.

Or even to trigger actions when a link in the email (sales email) is clicked.

Anyone done either of these?
I would personally use a behavioral event
<https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/analytics-tools/create-codeless-custom-behavioral-events>
Does this work just through an extension?
Yeah super simple no code way to track url visits
it is a marketing hub enterprise product though...
Which I'm now just realizing
Aargh ahaha
Yeah I'm trying to work around that
Because we simply don't need that for pretty much any of our marketing
We use Iterable
What CMS hub do you have?
CMS Hub nothing edition :joy:
lol
Our website isn't built on HubSpot at all
I was going to say serverless functions is an option
do you have the HubSpot tracking code installed?
Sorry what do you mean? In our website?
correct
I'm trying to track HubSpot created landing pages
for analytics
And forms
ah perfect
That are actually independent of our actual website
But are sent in "sales" emails
I thought when you say you don't use the HubSpot website that also meant the landing pages
Ah I email those out
sending a DM
Cool
Hey Jordan! You should be able to leverage the page visited event in the event triggers. I approved your portal for the event triggers beta :slightly_smiling_face:
:fire: we were just talking about the beta over DM, didn't know if it was publicly announced yet
Thanks Carter! Itâ€™s technically still in private beta but we are adding people to it as needed :smile: <@U01QVR44MEY>
of course just didn't want to put you guys in an awkward spot if it's not public yet, thanks for getting <@U04T2CUCP8T> in so quickly
